Welcome to YoloArts

At YoloArts, we are dedicated and determined to use the power of arts to strengthen and enrich our communities. We are continuing to develop new arts experiences in service to Yolo County.

The Barn Gallery
Give
Events

Our Mission

YoloArts is dedicated to cultivating and enriching people's lives through the arts.
Arts Education brings artists into the classroom to foster a creative community.
Gallery 625 provides space and opportunity for the exhibition of art.
Art in Public Places instills pride in the community landscape.
Art & Ag connects farmers, artists and the community in preserving agriculture.
Helping veterans find their voice, connect to the community and heal through the arts.
The I SEE YOU project uses art to encourage communication across social divides.
Connecting artists with commissions and exhibition opportunities the Artist Directory is a free resource.
Professional Development for artist equip and strengthen the county’s creative capital.
New Exhibition at the Gibson House

FEATURED MEMBER ARTIST
John Nichols
Two Dimensional Arts

My paintings strive to communicate my interpretation of each venue, creating a "sense of place".

Your Support Matters

the generosity of individual community members, businesses, local foundations and program partners contribute to the growth and preservation of arts and culture in Yolo County.

Support YoloArts

"Art has the potential to enhance the quality of our lives by adding depth, freshness and sometimes questioning the perceptions we take for granted in our everyday lives." Joseph Bellacera Artist

Our Email List

Stay in touch with our bi-monthly email
Receive updates and information on YoloArts’ programs, events and opportunities for artist.

YoloArts is funded in part by the California Arts Council, a state agency, the National Endowment for the Arts, a federal agency, and by YoloArts' membership and partners.
